channel.title: CNN.com - Top Stories
channel.description: CNN.com delivers up-to-the-minute news and information on the latest top stories, weather, entertainment, politics and more.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2015 Cable News Network LP, LLLP.

image.title: CNN.com - Top Stories
image.description: CNN.com delivers up-to-the-minute news and information on the latest top stories, weather, entertainment, politics and more.

item.title: Two children die in attacks blamed on Jewish extremists
Baby killed in 'price tag' attack
item.description: A Palestinian's home was burned during a "price tag" attack Friday that killed a toddler and critically injured at least three other relatives, Israeli and Palestinian officials said.

item.title: Firebombs thrown into home
item.description: A Palestinian's home was burned during a "price tag" attack that killed a toddler and critically injured at least three other relatives. CNN's Ian Lee has more.

item.title: Search for MH370: Twisted metal debris is ladder
Drone spotted near airliner
item.description: Another drone has been spotted flying near a commercial aircraft over New York, the Federal Aviation Administration said Monday.

item.title: Watch Ronaldo storm out of interview
item.description: It's a story that has dominated media headlines, but the corruption crisis that has engulfed FIFA is of no interest in the Real Madrid dressing room, according to world footballer of the year Cristiano Ronaldo.

item.title: Runaway anti-vaxxer mom captured
item.description: [Breaking news alert, posted at 3:22 p.m. ET Monday]

item.title: Batboy struck during warmup dies
item.description: A 9-year-old who was hit with a bat during a baseball game in Kansas over the weekend has died.

item.title: Distillers spike alcohol with Viagra
item.description: Chinese distillers have been spiking their booze with Sildenafil, better known as Viagra, and are often marketing them for their extra health "benefits."

item.title: U.S.: 'ISIS strong, growth halted'
item.description: ISIS remains "as strong as it was a year ago" when U.S. airstrikes against the group began, but it is no longer making rapid advances, according to an Obama administration official.

item.title: U.S. doctor named in 'illegal hunt'
item.description: Three days after demanding the extradition of a Minnesota dentist in connection with the killing of an iconic lion in Zimbabwe, the country has named another American in connection with an allegedly illegal hunt.

item.title: Suspect held over cop shooting
item.description: The man accused of killing an officer in Memphis, Tennessee, has surrendered to authorities, but the case is far from over, the city's police chief said.

item.title: Deadly flooding hits Asia
item.description: Millions of people are being affected by deadly flooding throughout southern Asia. Pakistan has been hit the most. CNN's Michael Holmes explains.

item.title: 7 dead in Legionnaires outbreak
item.description: The number of deaths in the New York City Legionnaires' disease outbreak is up to seven.

item.title: Sex claims against former UK PM
item.description: A UK police watchdog is investigating claims of child sex abuse by former PM Sir Edward Heath and if they were dropped because of threats to expose him.

item.title: Jimmy Carter has liver surgery
item.description: Former President Jimmy Carter had a "small mass" removed from his liver during surgery Monday, his office said.

item.title: HitchBOT beheaded in the U.S.
item.description: This is why we can't have nice hitchhiking robots.

item.title: Star surfs big waves -- on his bike
The intricacies of tattoo art
item.description: CNN talks to David Hale an illustrator, artist, and tattooist, about life inside the world of tattooing

item.title: $600K watch: Why heat is on Putin aide
The ultimate American road trip
item.description: Ah, the great American road trip. It's a rite of passage, a combination of nostalgia, discovery and misadventure ideally set against a sweeping landscape and killer tunes.

item.title: Death row prisoner set to die seven times
'Hell must be filled with beautiful women, no mirrors'
item.description: Winner of three Academy Awards, Australian costume designer Orry-Kelly created magic on screen, from Casablanca to Some Like it Hot, we look back.

item.title: Ronda Rousey takes down rival in 34 seconds
The story of Kunta Kinte, the slave who fought back
item.description: Kunta Kinte continues to captivate millions of Americans. His great, great, great, great grandchildren share his story.

item.title: Playboy's cars for sale, for a cool $3.5M
American F1 classics up for auction
Vision: F1 classic cars in 2056
item.description: British 3D artist Nathan Dearsley has imagined what a McLaren Formula 1 car could look like 40 years in the future. Browse through the gallery to see all the images.

item.title: Jodie Kidd: Runway to racetrack
item.description: British model, racer, TV presenter, and classic car aficionado Jodie Kidd might be the only person to have walked the runway as a Burberry model and cruised some of Europe's most prestigious circuits as a Maserati race driver.

item.title: 1914 classic car is still racing today
item.description: Nick Pellett talks to CNN Style about racing the oldest car at the Silverstone Classic his 1914 Sunbeam. Driving the car is a challenge in itself.

item.title: IOC makes 'zero' tolerance pledge on doping
Arsenal wins season curtain raiser
item.description: Arsenal laid down its marker for the English Premier League season by beating reigning champion Chelsea 1-0 to claim the FA Community Shield at Wembley Sunday.

item.title: Amazing blue city is new 'it' destination
Empire State Building pays tribute to Cecil the lion
Latest buzz in luxury hotels is ...
Making the world sparkle: Nadja Swarovski
A peek at tomorrow from today's top designers
item.description: Try asking someone in the industry how many "design weeks" you can fit into a 30-day month.

item.title: The best 'man cave' ever? The beer is on tap
Opinion: Encryption a growing threat to security
This 1914 classic car is still racing today
item.description: Nick Pellett talks to CNN Style about racing the oldest car at the Silverstone Classic his 1914 Sunbeam. Driving the car is a challenge in itself.

item.title: Cristiano Ronaldo storms off after being asked about FIFA
item.description: Football great Cristiano Ronaldo stormed off the set after being questioned about the FIFA scandal from CNN's Andres Oppenheimer.

item.title: The U.S. military's $400B fighter jet
item.description: The U.S. military prepares to declare its $400 billion F-35 fighter jet ready for initial combat use. CNN's Thom Patterson reports.

item.title: Reporter goes to extremes covering flooding
item.description: A reporter in Myanmar decided the best way to cover the flooding from heavy monsoon rains was to head into the water. CNN's Derek Van Dam has more.

item.title: Motocross star surfs big waves on his bike
item.description: Motocross veteran Robbie Maddison rides a modified dirt bike on huge waves in Tahiti.

item.title: Who is in the fight against ISIS?
item.description: CNN's Fred Pleitgen explains who is doing what in the battle against the terrorist group.

item.title: Why luxury hotels are turning to beekeeping
item.description: That honey in your cocktail? There's a good chance it was made by your hotel's very own bees.

item.title: The truth about Asian Americans' success
Iranians ready to retire 'Death to America'?
The homeowners who refused to budge
Beirut's 1960s jet-set playgrounds
item.description: For several decades the name "Beirut" has conjured images of devastation and danger.

item.title: Buildings on verge of destruction
item.description: Go see them now, before it's too late: threatened by neglect, the elements, changing architectural trends or ruthless developers, these outstanding buildings are all fighting a hard battle for survival.

item.title: World's 10 most scenic airport approaches
item.description: For jaded air travelers, window seats are overrated.

item.title: Ruins of the Soviet space shuttle program
item.description: What was once the gleaming pride and joy of the Soviet space program now lies covered in dirt and bird droppings in a disused hangar in Kazakhstan.

item.title: NASA finds 'Earth's bigger, older cousin'
item.description: NASA said Thursday that its Kepler spacecraft has spotted "Earth's bigger, older cousin": the first nearly Earth-size planet to be found in the habitable zone of a star similar to our own.

item.title: The king with 100 wives
item.description: Abumbi II, the 11th fon, or king, of Bafut, Cameroon, has close to 100 wives. They weren't all his to start. According to local tradition, when a fon dies, his successor inherits all his wives and then marries his own queens.

item.title: 10 watches that changed history
item.description: Mechanical watchmaking is not a world of revolutions, it's a world of evolutions, where change comes only slowly and tradition is a sacred trust. In the five hundred or so years that watches have existed, however, there have been a few that have changed the watchmaking world. Some of these watches broke new ground in design, some in technology -- and some both. Here are ten that made history and became part of it at the same time.

item.title: Girl from Vietnam War photo: Where is she?
item.description: Even without the benefit of context, the image of a naked 9-year-old girl running for her life is as searing and indelible today as it was 43 years ago.

item.title: Capturing beauty around the world
item.description: To photographer Mihaela Noroc, beauty cannot be defined by one country, race or ethnicity.
